title: Another Delay for the Starliner Crew Flight Test — now May 25
summary: Boeing is delaying the launch of the Starliner Crew Flight Test yet again. The most recent delay, from May 17 to May 21, was due to a helium leak in […]

title: Helium leak further delays Starliner crewed test flight
summary: NASA and Boeing have once again delayed first crewed flight of the company’s CST-100 Starliner as they work to resolve a helium leak in the spacecraft’s propulsion system.

title: India enters troubled space insurance market
summary: Indian insurance specialist Tata AIG is expanding into space as the global market reels from a string of heavy losses.

title: Startup’s chip design aims to boost satellite computing power
summary: A Carnegie Mellon University spinoff, Efficient Computer, developed a chip architecture that promises reduced energy consumption

title: It’s time to figure out global space traffic management
summary: Could commercial imperatives lay the groundwork for well-defined, coherent space traffic management norms and erect space sustainability guardrails?

title: Omnispace reports interference from Starlink direct-to-device payloads
summary: Omnispace says it is seeing interference from direct-to-device payloads on recently launched SpaceX Starlink satellites, offering an early test of new Federal Communications Commission regulations about such services.

title: NASA and ESA complete agreement for cooperation on Mars rover mission
summary: NASA and the European Space Agency have completed an agreement under which NASA will provide hundreds of millions of dollars of support for a European Mars rover mission.

title: NASA, ESA Formalize Expanded Cooperation on ESA’s Mars Rover
summary: NASA and the European Space Agency signed an agreement today formalizing NASA’s expanded role in ESA’s Rosalind Frankin Mars rover program. ESA terminated its cooperation with Russia on the ExoMars […]

title: Government revenue and AT&T direct-to-smartphone agreement lift AST SpaceMobile
summary: AST SpaceMobile’s shares closed up more than 68% after announcing a revenue-sharing deal with AT&T, which plans to use its proposed direct-to-device satellites to keep smartphones connected in cellular dead zones.

title: Lithuania Becomes 40th Artemis Accords Signatory
summary: The number of countries signing the U.S.-led Artemis Accords is now up to 40. Lithuania joined yesterday and Slovenia signed last month. The Accords are a set of non-binding principles […]
